p: The pollen supplementation experiment revealed that seed set was significantly affected by pollination treatment ( χ 2 = 11.886, df = 1, p = 0.0006) and year ( χ 2 = 5.074, df = 1, p = 0.0243). ‘Pollen supplemented’ plants showed on average 2.4% more filled achenes than ‘Open pollination’ ones (z = 3.521, p = 0.0004, Fig 4A). Seed set declined in 2015, and the percentage of fully developed achenes was on average 5.4% lower than in the previous year (z = -2.373, p = 0.0176, Fig 4B). Neither pollination treatment ( χ 2 = 1.356, df = 1, p = 0.24) nor year ( χ 2 = 0.122, df = 1, p = 0.72) affected the oil content of filled achenes.
